FwkSenCnt.MEANING: seriously injure sb - with lasting damage

ExCnt.EX: Despite October's United Nations-brokered peace accord , landmines still maim about 300 people every month .
More than 300,000 French soldiers were killed , maimed or taken prisoner in this futile exercise .
Dolphins were often cruelly maimed or killed during such research , but , thankfully , today 's studies tend to focus on animals in the wild , and mostly aim to be as non-intrusive as possible .
They were coming again ; coming to kill and maim and blast and burn .
What looked like a whole detachment of maimed soldiers was sitting under a tree playing cards .
The city can easily be mistaken as a typical third world city rushing casually into the modern era with choking dust and fumes , stinking gutters , touts , maimed beggars and building sites .
In outdoor rehab tanks , maimed sea turtles swam sadly , waiting for their return to the ocean .
The Queensland Government has spent $ 1.4m on a TV campaign showing graphic images of maimed bodies and mangled car wrecks , which will be shown across the Easter period .
